main event: A bright, round, bluish-white object was observed hovering and swinging slowly over Syracuse, New York on February 14, 1955.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a fluorescent light bulb and remained stationary, slowly swinging from side to side for 25-30 minutes.
The object was observed by a USAF witness at an altitude of approximately 3,000 feet.
No visible details were reported, but the object faded from view gradually.
Shortly before the sighting, a trainee was traveling a route from the base at Syracuse, and about 10 minutes later, a Captain in another aircraft also noticed the object.
The object did not seem to be moving steadily, but would suddenly speed up and then slow down.
